body.p: Which of these areas of the brain does not receive impulses associated with the gustatory sense?

response.feedback: Incorrect. The medulla oblongata is part of the brain stem that receives input from the three cranial nerves involved in taste.
Incorrect. The thalamus is critical for consciousness of sensations and routes the signal to proper part of cerebral cortex.
Correct. The primary gustatory cortex is lateral and part of the parietal lobe, not posterior part of cerebral cortex.
Incorrect. While subconscious it still receives input to moderate reflexes associated with taste.
Incorrect. While subconscious it still receives input to moderate reflexes associated with taste.
